choices: A. Dew forming on grass in the morning
B. Water boiling to form steam
C. Ice cubes shrinking in the freezer
D. Clothes drying on a line

1162.question: A study concluded that individuals who sleep less than 6 hours a night have higher stress levels. This conclusion was drawn from a study of 150 college students. What is a potential bias in this investigation?
choices: A. The study included too many participants.
B. Only young adults were included in the study.
C. The study did not measure stress accurately.
D. Participants were not asked about their diet.

choices: A. Reports identify errors during the analysis.
B. Reports confirm the analysis was repeated multiple times.
C. Reports eliminate the necessity to redo the analysis.
D. Reports ensure the analysis results are precise.

1166.question: Students are exploring how the movements of the Earth and Moon influence phenomena on Earth. After one lunar month has passed, which of the following has taken place?
choices: A. The Earth has completed one rotation on its axis.
B. The Earth has completed one revolution around the Moon.
C. The Moon has completed one orbit around the Earth.
D. The Sun has completed one orbit around the Moon.

1167.question: Which of the following is a characteristic shared by both radio waves and microwaves?
choices: A. Both are part of the electromagnetic spectrum.
B. Both require a medium to travel.
C. Both have the same wavelength.
D. Both can be seen by the human eye.

1168.question: Which of these is a behavior of dogs in response to fear?
choices: A. Tail tucked under the body

1169.question: Which method is most effective for determining if light exposure affects plant growth?
choices: A. Grow three plants, each under different light intensities.
B. Grow three plants all under the same light intensity.
C. Grow one plant with light and one without light.
D. Grow three plants, each in a different type of soil.
